qas.question: Which weaponry research did Feynman engage in?
Whose division was Feynman assigned to at the Manhattan Project?
What did Feynman produce with the help of Bethe?
What was the purpose of the Bethe-Feynman formula?

answers.text: calculating the yield of a fission bomb

qas.question: Who had previously worked on fission bomb yields before Feynman?
Which weaponry research did Feynman oppose?
Whose division was Feynman restricted from at the Manhattan Project?
What did Feynman produce without the help of Bethe?

plausible_answers.text: calculating the yield of a fission bomb

qas.question: Why was the Bethe-Feynman formula unnecessary?
Who had never worked on fission bomb yields before Feynman?

context: At Princeton, the physicist Robert R. Wilson encouraged Feynman to participate in the <a0_0><b5_0>Manhattan Project<b5_0/><a0_0/>—the wartime U.S. Army project at Los Alamos developing the atomic bomb. Feynman said he was persuaded to join this effort to build it before Nazi Germany developed their own bomb. He was assigned to <a1_0><b6_0>Hans Bethe<b6_0/><a1_0/>'s theoretical division and impressed Bethe enough to be made a group leader. He and Bethe developed the <a2_0><b7_0>Bethe–Feynman formula<b7_0/><a2_0/> for <a3_0><b8_0>calculating the yield of a fission bomb<b8_0/><a3_0/>, which built upon previous work by <a4_0><b9_0>Robert Serber<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
